item.title: 美国法官阻止埃隆-马斯克的 DOGE 获取社保记录
item.description: 一名联邦法官周四阻止了埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的政府效率部（Department of Government Efficiency）查阅社会保障记录，作为其在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统领导下追捕欺诈和浪费行为的一部分，并称这种行为是 "钓鱼探险"。【原文：A federal judge on Thursday blocked Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency from accessing Social Security records as part of its hunt under President Donald Trump for fraud and waste, calling the effort a "fishing expedition."】

item.title: 美国法官阻止埃隆-马斯克的 DOGE 获取社保记录
item.description: 一名联邦法官周四阻止了埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的政府效率部（Department of Government Efficiency）查阅社会保障记录，作为其在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统领导下追捕欺诈和浪费行为的一部分，并称这种行为是 "钓鱼探险"。【原文：A federal judge on Thursday blocked Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency from accessing Social Security records as part of its hunt under President Donald Trump for fraud and waste, calling the effort a "fishing expedition."】

item.title: 西南航空航班因机组人员将奥兰多滑行道误认为跑道而取消起飞
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局称，美国西南航空公司一架航班周四在奥兰多机场起飞时，误在滑行道而非跑道上起飞，导致飞机中止起飞。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration said a Southwest Airlines flight at Orlando airport on Thursday aborted takeoff after it mistakenly began to depart on a taxiway rather than the runway.】

item.title: 美国食品和药物管理局宣布建立在线数据库追踪食品污染物
item.description: 美国食品和药物管理局周四推出了一个可在线搜索的数据库，列出了人类食品中的污染物含量，这反映了卫生部长小罗伯特-肯尼迪自上任以来为减少食品中的化学物质所做的不懈努力。【原文：The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Thursday launched an online searchable database listing contaminant levels in human foods, reflecting Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s ongoing efforts to reduce chemicals in food since taking office.】

item.title: 美国延长纽约结束曼哈顿拥堵计划的最后期限
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）政府周四将纽约州3月21日结束曼哈顿交通拥堵收费项目的最后期限延长了30天。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's administration on Thursday extended by 30 days a March 21 deadline for New York state to end Manhattan's congestion pricing program.】

item.title: 特朗普在白宫签署命令，为解散教育部再下一城
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将于周四签署一项行政命令，试图解散教育部，将学校政策交由各州制定，兑现让保守派人士振奋、让教育倡导者担忧的竞选承诺。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump will sign an executive order on Thursday that seeks to dismantle the Department of Education and leave school policy in the hands of states, making good on a campaign promise that has energized conservatives and worried education advocates.】

item.title: 美国拒绝墨西哥关于科罗拉多河水特别输送通道的请求
item.description: 美国国务院周四表示，美国将首次拒绝墨西哥提出的一项非条约请求，即为科罗拉多河水向提华纳提供一条特别输送渠道。【原文：The U.S. Department of State said on Thursday that the United States will for the first time deny a non-treaty request by Mexico for a special delivery channel for Colorado River water to be delivered to Tijuana.】

item.title: 玛丽亚-凯莉赢得《我想要的圣诞礼物就是你》版权官司
item.description: 流行歌手玛丽亚-凯莉（Mariah Carey）打赢了一场官司，这场官司声称玛丽亚-凯莉非法抄袭了她的节日巨作《All I Want for Christmas Is You》中的同名乡村歌曲元素。【原文：Pop singer Mariah Carey defeated a lawsuit claiming she illegally copied elements of her holiday megahit "All I Want for Christmas Is You" from a country song of the same name.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚大学在特朗普最后期限前满足对校园抗议活动的要求
item.description: 哥伦比亚大学周四将在最后期限前对九项关于收紧校园抗议限制的要求做出回应，特朗普政府称，这些要求是就恢复被暂停的4亿美元联邦拨款展开谈判的先决条件。【原文：Columbia University faced a Thursday deadline to respond to nine demands on tightening restrictions on campus protests that the Trump administration says are preconditions for opening talks on restoring $400 million in suspended federal funding.】

item.title: 美国司法部长称，针对特斯拉的纵火犯将面临指控
item.description: 美国司法部长帕梅拉-邦迪（Pamela Bondi）周四表示，已有三人因特斯拉汽车经销商和充电站纵火事件受到指控。 司法部没有具体说明指控罪名，但表示这些人每人将面临 5 到 20 年的监禁。【原文：U.S. Attorney General Pamela Bondi on Thursday said three people have been charged related to arson incidents at Tesla car dealerships and charging stations. Without specifying the charges, the Justice Department said the individuals each face between five and 20 years in prison.】

item.title: 布莱克-莱弗利要求驳回贾斯汀-巴尔多尼 4 亿美元的诽谤诉讼案
item.description: 女演员布莱克-莱弗利（Blake Lively）周四要求美国法官驳回男演员贾斯汀-巴尔多尼（Justin Baldoni）4亿美元的诽谤诉讼，称这是一起 "报复性的、漫无边际的 "案件，不属于联邦法院。【原文：Actress Blake Lively on Thursday asked a U.S. judge to dismiss actor Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit, calling it a "vengeful and rambling" case that does not belong in federal court.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会的解雇可能使消费者裁决陷入法律困境
item.description: 专家们说，唐纳德-特朗普总统解雇联邦贸易委员会的两名委员使美国消费者保护工作陷入了未知的水域，在法院澄清被解雇委员的地位之前，其行动处于法律的边缘。【原文：President Donald Trump's firing of two commissioners at the Federal Trade Commission puts the U.S. consumer protection in uncharted waters, its actions are in legal limbo until courts clarify the status of the fired commissioners, experts said.】

item.title: 备忘录称，特朗普官员提出改革美国对外援助的计划
item.description: 根据一份内部备忘录，特朗普政府已准备好一项提案，以彻底改革华盛顿如何分配数十亿美元对外援助的结构，该提案呼吁减少对其认为更符合美国地缘政治利益的领域的资助。【原文：The Trump administration has prepared a proposal to overhaul the structure of how Washington distributes billions of dollars of foreign aid, according to an internal memo that calls for funding fewer areas that it views as better aligned with U.S. geopolitical interests.】

item.title: 指责特朗普攻击司法机构的美国法官被排除道德投诉
item.description: 一名美国法官因在美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）上公开反对针对司法机构成员的威胁，并回应唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对纽约一案主审法官女儿的评论而洗脱了不法行为的嫌疑。【原文：A U.S. judge has been cleared of wrongdoing for going on CNN to speak out against threats made against members of the judiciary and respond to Donald Trump's comments about the daughter of the judge who presided over the New York case in which the now-president was convicted last year.】

item.title: 保守派团体敦促联邦通信委员会结束对《60 分钟》哈里斯采访的调查
item.description: 保守派权益组织周四要求联邦通信委员会驳回对哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS）"60 分钟 "栏目采访时任副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）的投诉。【原文：Conservative advocacy groups on Thursday asked the Federal Communications Commission to reject a complaint over CBS's "60 Minutes" interview with then-Vice President Kamala Harris.】

item.title: 纽约市允许非公民投票的法律被法院驳回
item.description: 纽约州最高法院周四否决了纽约市一项允许 80 多万合法非公民在市政选举中投票的法律。【原文：New York State's top court on Thursday struck down a New York City law that would have permitted more than 800,000 legal non-citizens to vote in municipal elections.】

item.title: 卫冕冠军凯尔特人队同意以破纪录的 61 亿美元出售球队
item.description: NBA 卫冕冠军波士顿凯尔特人队周四表示，已同意以 61 亿美元的价格出售给由私募股权公司 Symphony Technology Group 联合创始人威廉-奇肖姆（William Chisholm）领导的集团。【原文：The reigning NBA champion Boston Celtics have agreed to a $6.1 billion sale to a group headed by private equity firm Symphony Technology Group co-founder William Chisholm, the team said on Thursday.】

item.title: 白宫表示，学生贷款和佩尔助学金项目仍将由教育部管理
item.description: 白宫周四表示，学生贷款和佩尔助学金项目仍将由美国教育部负责管理，特朗普总统准备签署一项行政命令，旨在关闭这一联邦机构。【原文：Student loan and Pell grant programs will still be run by the U.S. Department of Education, the White House said on Thursday, as President Trump prepared to sign a executive order aimed at shutting down the federal agency.】

item.title: 美国参议院民主党人呼吁特朗普医疗保险提名人奥兹医生缴纳 40 万美元的逃税税款
item.description: 两位美国民主党参议员周四表示，被唐纳德-特朗普总统提名监督政府医疗保险和医疗补助健康计划的名医麦赫麦特-奥兹（Mehmet Oz）博士应承诺缴纳他所逃避的 40 多万美元的税款。【原文：Dr. Mehmet Oz, the celebrity physician nominated by President Donald Trump to oversee the government's Medicare and Medicaid health plans, should commit to paying over $400,000 in taxes he avoided, two Democratic U.S. Senators said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普政府将就驱逐问题做出回应，法官将权衡可能的违规行为
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政府在周四面临一个最后期限，即在法官考虑官员们是否违反了他暂时阻止驱逐令的同时，对司法部门要求提供更多有关驱逐数百名委内瑞拉移民的细节做出回应。【原文：President Donald Trump's administration faced a deadline on Thursday to respond to a judicial request for more details on the deportation of hundreds of Venezuelan migrants as the judge considers whether officials violated his order temporarily blocking the expulsions.】

item.title: 美国农业部将投资高达 1 亿美元开展抗击禽流感项目
item.description: 美国农业部周四表示，它计划投资高达 1 亿美元的项目，帮助研究有助于防治禽流感的疗法和潜在候选疫苗。【原文：The U.S. Department of Agriculture said on Thursday it plans to invest up to $100 million in projects that will help in research of therapies and potential vaccine candidates to help combat bird flu.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国公民格列兹曼被塔利班释放并返回美国
item.description: 一位知情人士告诉路透社记者，在美国人质特使亚当-博勒（Adam Boehler）与塔利班官员在喀布尔举行会谈之后，塔利班于周四释放了一名被关押在阿富汗两年多的美国公民。【原文：The Taliban on Thursday freed an American citizen who had been detained in Afghanistan for more than two years, following talks between U.S. hostage envoy Adam Boehler and Taliban officials in Kabul, a source briefed on the release told Reuters.】

item.title: GEO 集团与美国移民及海关执法局签署协议，将在密歇根州开设移民处理中心
item.description: 美国移民与海关执法局（U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement）和私营监狱运营商GEO集团（GEO Group）周四表示，双方已达成协议，将立即在密歇根州中部开设一个联邦移民处理中心。【原文：U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement and private prison operator GEO Group have brokered an agreement to open a federal immigration processing center immediately in central Michigan, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 2 月成屋销售意外增长
item.description: 随着供应量的增加将买家重新拉回市场，美国 2 月份的成屋销售意外增长，但经济不确定性的上升可能会限制成屋销售的进一步增长。【原文：U.S. existing home sales unexpectedly increased in February as rising supply pulled buyers back into the market, but rising economic uncertainty could limit further gains.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数小幅上升，劳动力市场保持稳定
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数量略有增加，表明 3 月份劳动力市场保持稳定，但在贸易紧张局势加剧和政府大幅削减开支的情况下，劳动力市场的前景正变得暗淡。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased slightly last week, suggesting the labor market remained stable in March, though the outlook is darkening amid rising trade tensions and deep cuts in government spending.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数小幅上升，劳动力市场保持稳定
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数量略有增加，表明 3 月份劳动力市场保持稳定，但在贸易紧张局势加剧和政府大幅削减开支的情况下，劳动力市场的前景正变得暗淡。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased slightly last week, suggesting the labor market remained stable in March, though the outlook is darkening amid rising trade tensions and deep cuts in government spending.】

item.title: 特朗普暂停进口关税后，美国公司竞相争取进口关税豁免
item.description: 业内专家表示，华盛顿对《美国-墨西哥-加拿大协定》（USMCA）所涵盖商品进口关税的临时宽免引发了寻求贸易协定豁免的美国公司激增。【原文：Washington's temporary relief for import tariffs on goods covered under the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) has triggered a spike in US companies seeking exemption under the trade deal, industry experts said.】

item.title: 特拉华州立法者在批评声中就公司法改革进行表决
item.description: 特拉华州的立法者预计将于本周四投票通过对该州公司法的全面改革，以保护其有利于商业的声誉，但反对者称该法案是对亿万富翁的恩赐。【原文：Delaware lawmakers are expected to vote to overhaul the state's corporate law on Thursday to protect its business-friendly reputation, but opponents have called the bill a giveaway to billionaires.】

item.title: 退伍军人事务部的调整扰乱了部分美国退伍军人的心理健康服务
item.description: 乔伊-科尔特斯（Joey Cortez）曾在美国空军服役 24 年，自 8 月份以来，他一直在等待退伍军人事务部的心理健康专家为他看病，但就在这时，他又经历了一次新的焦虑。【原文：Joey Cortez, who served 24 years in the U.S. Air Force, had been waiting since August to see a mental health specialist from the Department of Veterans' Affairs, when he experienced a fresh jolt of anxiety.】

item.title: 白雪公主》上映后饱受争议
item.description: 迪斯尼的《白雪公主》将于本周五上映，此前该片曾饱受争议，将这部重述 1937 年经典动画的影片拖入了文化战争的泥潭，对其票房表现构成了潜在威胁。【原文：Disney’s "Snow White" reaches theaters on Friday, after having been dogged by controversies that dragged the retelling of the 1937 animated classic into the culture wars, potentially threatening its box office performance.】
